page.title: 17Treen/Penberth WI, St. Levan
page.content: Treen & Penberth Women's Institute held its first meeting on 2nd. October 1970. Meetings are held on the third Wednesday of every month, in Treen Chapel at 7-30p.m. except in August, with a committee meeting held on the preceeding Monday. Membership (20 at present) is three pounds per annum, open to women over 14 years old. This institute has a junior membership starting at 10 years old. Each month there is a competition based on the subject of the speaker. The movement is based on the spiritual ideals of Fellowship, Truth, Tolerance and Justice. Treen & Penberth WI support the RNLI as a favourite charity and have worked on social concerns such as main line rail closure in Cornwall, and VAT tax. The Royal Cornwall Show is a long way to travel with entries, but they did get a second prize once.
